definitions.definition: A polysaccharide extracted from the cell walls of plants, especially of fruits; under acidic conditions it forms a gel . It is often used in processed foods, especially jellies and jams where it causes thickening ( setting ).
examples: Apple is rich in pectin and so is often added to other fruits when making jam so it will set.

main_definition: ( biochemistry ) A polysaccharide extracted from the cell walls of plants, especially of fruits; under acidic conditions it forms a gel . It is often used in processed foods, especially jellies and jams where it causes thickening ( setting ).
